subject: Re: [junit] Contributing to JUnit -- Questions
msgSnippet: David (or anyone else really), Are there any other items that people want worked on? Thanks, Corey ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
David (or anyone else really),

Are there any other items that people want worked on?

Thanks,

Corey


On Tue, Nov 13, 2012 at 4:19 PM, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

> #157 should be super quick. Thanks!
>
> David
>
>
> On Sun, Nov 11, 2012 at 10:07 PM, Corey Vaillancourt <coreyjv@...
> >wrote:
>
> > **
> >
> >
> > Now that I've essentially wrapped up work on issue #144 are there any
> > other items that folks would like someone to work on?
> >
> > Thanks!
> >
> > Corey
> >
> >
> > On Nov 5, 2012, at 16:04, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> >
> > > Corey,
> > >
> > > Welcome! I would recommend starting off with something small, perhaps
> > like
> > > https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/144. More than half of the
> > effort
> > > for first-time contributors tends to be caught up in code formatting,
> > > GitHub wrangling, and getting used to the "team" structure. Best to get
> > > that under your belt after just a couple dozen new lines of code. Some
> > > earnest contributors start with a thousand-line patch, only to get
> > > frustrated before we can work together to massage it into something
> > > pullable.
> > >
> > > Thanks for checking in here!
> > >
> > > David
> > >
> > >
> > > On Sat, Nov 3, 2012 at 7:59 PM, Corey Vaillancourt <coreyjv@...
> > >wrote:
> > >
> > >> **
> >
> > >>
> > >>
> > >> I apologize at the outset if this is the wrong forum for this
> question,
> > but
> > >> I couldn't find any location on GitHub or the website to ask and the
> > >> developer's mailing list did not seem terribly active. If there is a
> > >> location for reference please let me know and I apologize for missing
> > it.
> > >>
> > >> I'm a developer and I'm interested in contributing to the project. How
> > can
> > >> I be of assistance? I noticed a number of open issues on GitHub but it
> > >> wasn't immediately discernible to me which issues were available for
> > active
> > >> work.
> > >>
> > >> Thanks for your time,
> > >>
> > >> Corey
> > >>
